title: Party of Communists of Kyrgyzstan
text:
The Party of Communists of Kyrgyzstan is a <a href="communist%20party">communist party</a> in <a href="Kyrgyzstan">Kyrgyzstan</a>, founded on 22 June 1992. It publishes the <a href="daily%20newspaper">daily newspaper</a> "Pravda Kyrgyzstana" (). The party considers itself to be the successor of the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20Kirghizia">Communist Party of Kirghizia</a>, which ruled Kyrgyzstan during the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a> era.
It was the largest political party in the <a href="Legislative%20Assembly%20of%20Kyrgyzstan">Legislative Assembly of Kyrgyzstan</a> between 2001 and 2005, with 15 of the 60 seats. In the <a href="2005%20Kyrgyz%20parliamentary%20election">2005 parliamentary election</a> it won 1 of the 75 seats. Two years later, the party took eight seats in the larger 90-seat Supreme Council. However, the party failed to win any seats in successive legislative elections held in <a href="2010%20Kyrgyz%20parliamentary%20election">2010</a> and <a href="2015%20Kyrgyz%20parliamentary%20election">2015</a>. In the <a href="2020%20Kyrgyz%20parliamentary%20election">2020 parliamentary election</a>, party leader <a href="Iskhak%20Masaliyev">Iskhak Masaliyev</a> ran on the <a href="United%20Kyrgyzstan">United Kyrgyzstan</a> list.
The party was formerly led by <a href="Absamat%20Masaliyev">Absamat Masaliyev</a>, a former leader of the <a href="Kirghiz%20Soviet%20Socialist%20Republic">Kirghiz SSR</a> during the Soviet era, until his death in 2004. The party's current chairman is <a href="Bumairam%20Mamaseitova">Bumairam Mamaseitova</a>.
